A Marblehead man convicted earlier this month of raping an eighth-grader after buying alcohol for her and another girl was sentenced to nine to 11 years in state prison yesterday. John Murphy, 24, was found guilty two weeks ago of child rape and providing alcohol to minors following a weeklong trial in Lawrence Superior Court. Yesterday, Judge Richard Welch III sentenced Murphy to spend at least nine years in prison for the crimes, to be followed by five years of probation. Prosecutor Karen Hopwood, who had sought a longer prison term of 12 to 14 years, said the victim and her friends met Murphy on the Gerry School playground in Marblehead on the evening of June 12, 2009. John Murphy, a former member of the Defence Forces, was sentenced to consecutive terms totalling 18 years for rape, indecent and sexual assault against his daughter Sophia. He had appealed the sentence on the grounds it was “excessive, disproportionate, and unfair in all the circumstances”. But in a judgment delivered today by Ms Justice Aileen Donnelly, Murphy’s attempt to have his jail time reduced was rejected

This week marks the 25th anniversary of the guilty verdict of John Merzbacher, a former schoolteacher convicted of the rape of Elizabeth Murphy in the 1970s, when she was a student at the Catholic Community Middle School in South Baltimore. A Baltimore City jury found the teacher guilty in 1994, after Ms. Murphy was an adult, of eight charges of rape and abuse
